publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4080# Mr Frank McAveety: Supporters Direct in Scotland—That the Parliament recognises the work carried out by Supporters Direct in Scotland in promoting and supporting the concept of democratic supporter ownership and representation in Scottish football through mutual, not-for-profit structures; notes the role of Supporters Direct in Scotland in promoting football clubs as civic and community institutions and welcomes the development of Supporters Direct among Glasgow football clubs and across Scotland; further notes the contribution of Supporters Direct in Scotland to preserving the competitive values of football in Scotland through promoting the health of the game as a whole, and applauds Supporters Direct in Scotland’s aim of helping people who wish to play a responsible part in the life of the football club they support through support, advice and information to groups of football supporters. Supported by: Richard Baker*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Jackie Baillie*, Christine May*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Trish Godman*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Brian Adam*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bill Butler*, Michael McMahon*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Scott Barrie*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Robin Harper*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Marlyn Glen*, Phil Gallie*, Karen Whitefield*, Bristow Muldoon*

S2M-4080# Mr Frank McAveety: Supporters Direct in Scotland—That the Parliament recognises the work carried out by Supporters Direct in Scotland in promoting and supporting the concept of democratic supporter ownership and representation in Scottish football through mutual, not-for-profit structures; notes the role of Supporters Direct in Scotland in promoting football clubs as civic and community institutions and welcomes the development of Supporters Direct among Glasgow football clubs and across Scotland; further notes the contribution of Supporters Direct in Scotland to preserving the competitive values of football in Scotland through promoting the health of the game as a whole, and applauds Supporters Direct in Scotland’s aim of helping people who wish to play a responsible part in the life of the football club they support through support, advice and information to groups of football supporters. Supported by: Richard Baker, Dr Elaine Murray, Jackie Baillie, Christine May, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Bill Butler, Michael McMahon, Margaret Jamieson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Fiona Hyslop, Scott Barrie, Karen Gillon, Mr Duncan McNeil, Robin Harper, Marlyn Glen, Phil Gallie, Karen Whitefield, Bristow Muldoon, Pauline McNeill*, Dennis Canavan*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Chris Ballance*, Donald Gorrie*, Colin Fox*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Iain Smith*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Linda Fabiani*, John Swinburne*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Frances Curran*
S2M-4080# Supporters Direct in Scotland (lodged on 8 March 2006) Susan Deacon*

S2M-4080# Mr Frank McAveety: Supporters Direct in Scotland—That the Parliament recognises the work carried out by Supporters Direct in Scotland in promoting and supporting the concept of democratic supporter ownership and representation in Scottish football through mutual, not-for-profit structures; notes the role of Supporters Direct in Scotland in promoting football clubs as civic and community institutions and welcomes the development of Supporters Direct among Glasgow football clubs and across Scotland; further notes the contribution of Supporters Direct in Scotland to preserving the competitive values of football in Scotland through promoting the health of the game as a whole, and applauds Supporters Direct in Scotland’s aim of helping people who wish to play a responsible part in the life of the football club they support through support, advice and information to groups of football supporters. Supported by: Richard Baker, Dr Elaine Murray, Jackie Baillie, Christine May, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Trish Godman, Mr Jamie Stone, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Bill Butler, Michael McMahon, Margaret Jamieson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Fiona Hyslop, Scott Barrie, Karen Gillon, Mr Duncan McNeil, Robin Harper, Marlyn Glen, Phil Gallie, Karen Whitefield, Bristow Muldoon, Pauline McNeill, Dennis Canavan, Chris Ballance, Donald Gorrie, Colin Fox, Marilyn Livingstone, Iain Smith, Linda Fabiani, John Swinburne, Frances Curran, Susan Deacon, Paul Martin*, Sarah Boyack*
